title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1803.2 - Applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1803.2 - Applications

State Regulations
(a) One signed
original and two conformed copies of the respective forms hereinafter mentioned
shall be submitted to the commissioner in connection with a request for
financial assistance, except that where no federal financial assistance is
involved, no federal forms, documents or contracts and no federal approvals are
required: (1)

Application for financial
assistance. The application is to be submitted with two certified copies of the
capital grant contract between the municipality and federal government; or loan
and grant contract between the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency and federal
government and cooperation agreement between the municipality and the Municipal

Urban Renewal Agency; two copies of each of the following: Project Cost

Estimate and Financial Plan, HUD form H-6200, Project Expenditures Budget, HUD
form H-6220, as approved with attached explanation of differences; Schedule of

Urban Renewal Insurance Coverage, HUD form H-6206, or a certificate of
insurance showing all federally required coverage; and the workable program
requirements as contained in section
1806.1. (2)

In the case of a municipality, a
resolution authorizing the submission adopted by the governing body. (3)

In the case of a Municipal Urban Renewal

Agency, (i) a resolution authorizing the
submission adopted by the governing body of the municipality, (ii)
a resolution authorizing the submission
adopted by the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency. (4)

Schedule supporting the request for
assistance. (b) Three
duplicate originals or certified copies of the following documentation shall be
submitted to the commissioner with a request for community renewal program
grant: (1)

The application for the community
renewal program grant submitted to HUD. (2)

Amendatory application, if any. (3)

Local Approved Data--Community Renewal

Program, including community renewal program in duplicate. (4)

Federal community renewal program grant
contract. (5)

Resolution of
governing body approving application for State community renewal program
grant. (6)

If applicant is not the
municipality, in addition to resolution required in the preceding paragraph
(5), supra, a resolution by agency authorizing submission of the application
for State community renewal program grant. (7)

Opinion of counsel for applicant with
respect to application to the State for community renewal program
grant. (c) Three
duplicate originals or certified copies of the following documents should be
submitted to the commissioner with the request for a concentrated code
enforcement grant: (1)

The application for a
concentrated code enforcement grant submitted to HUD, including HUD Forms
H-6170 and H-6171, or alternates. (2)

Amendatory application, if any. (3)

Designation of urban renewal
area. (4)

Urban renewal
plan. (5)

Federal grant contract
for code enforcement. (6)
HUD
authorization to incur costs. (7)
(i) Evidence of public hearing on urban
renewal plan by commission. (ii)

Resolution of commission, approving urban renewal plan, showing vote
thereon. (iii)

Evidence of public
hearing on urban renewal plan by governing body. (iv)

Resolution of governing body, approving
urban renewal plan, showing vote thereon. (8)

Application for State capital grant for
concentrated code enforcement. (9)

Resolution of governing body approving application for State capital grant for
concentrated code enforcement. (10)

Opinion of counsel of municipality with respect to application for State
capital grant contract for concentrated code enforcement. Notes
